snippet: The Justice Department strongly endorsed a monitor to oversee changes if a judge were to find the New York Police Department’s practices to be unconstitutional.
abstract: Justice Department wades into federal trial over New York Police Dept's stop-and-frisk practices, strongly endorsing a monitor to oversee changes if Judge Shira A Scheindlin finds the practices to be unconstitutional; so-called statement of interest from Justice Dept stops short of offering department itself as monitor.
lead_paragraph: The Justice Department strongly endorsed a monitor to oversee changes if a judge were to find the New York Police Department’s practices to be unconstitutional.

headline.main: U.S. Offers Conditional Support for Police Monitor in Stop-and-Frisk Case
headline.print_headline: U.S. Offers Conditional Support for Police Monitor in Stop-and-Frisk Case
